RIO DE JANEIRO  Inmates at the maximum security prison in the city of Aracaju , the capital of the northeastern Brazilian state of Sergipe , on Sunday released 125 relatives and four prison guards they had been holding hostage for the past 26 hours , authorities said .

Two of the guards had minor injuries but the rest of the hostages were unharmed after a lengthy negotiating session conducted by the police and members of the public entities responsible for the prison system and judiciary .
